thread.title: Tree roots block sanitary sewer pipe, causing sewer overflow in Dubuque
thread.title_full: Tree roots block sanitary sewer pipe, causing sewer overflow in Dubuque

author: @KCRG
title: Tree roots block sanitary sewer pipe, causing sewer overflow in Dubuque
text:
Tree roots block sanitary sewer pipe, causing sewer overflow in Dubuque
DUBUQUE, Iowa (KCRG) - Tree roots caused a blockage in a sanitary sewer pipe Wednesday, leading to a sewer overflow in Dubuque.
According to a release from the City of Dubuque, “tree roots grew into and blocked a sanitary sewer pipe” near the 3000 block of Spring Valley Road.
The blockage resulted in a sanitary sewer overflow, causing untreated wastewater to spill into the storm sewer system at Spring Valley Road and John F. Kennedy Road.
City of Dubuque officials were notified of the incident at approximately 7:30 a.m., and arrived on site by 8:00 a.m.
Public Works Department staff removed the blockage by approximately 9:15 a.m.
The Iowa Department of Natural Resources is warning individuals to keep their children and pets away from the area for 48 hours.
